tier.item: For the Chantyal examples, notations like [I110] refer to the clause numbers of the examples in pub-
lished discourses and can be found either in Noonan 2005a [discourses A-U] or Noonan 1999 [discourses
7 The patient nominal in (7b) can't be analyzed as consisting of a head followed by a postmodifier since
postmodifiers don't otherwise occur in Chantyal. What are referred to here as agent and patient nomi-
nals could alternatively be analyzed as internally headed relative clauses.

tier.item: There are, for example, two productive simple locatives, an ablative, an allative, a circumlative, an ela-
tive, an inessive, a superessive, a subessive, and two comitatives. Many of these are transparently recent
`[It] came from around that side of the gorge yonder'
There are, for example, two productive simple locatives, an ablative, an allative, a circumlative, an ela-
tive, an inessive, a superessive, a subessive, and two comitatives. Many of these are transparently recent
